Elisa and Dominic where excellent hosts and made us feel welcome in their home from the start. Elisa sent us detailed information even before we arrived and personally met us when we arrived. The room was bright, clean and comfortable with a pleasant decor.  It was fantastic to have access to a separate bathroom. We loved the healthy and tasty breakfast served to us.  The location of their residence is very central and easily accessible by transit. We liked the diversity  of the neighbourhood and medley of restaurant options available there. We would definitely like to stay there again if we revisit London.

The host made us feel welcome straight away! Really nice people, amazing location with very easy access to the underground. Room and private bathroom/toilet in very good condition too! I would definitely recommend it to anyone interested :-)
Very pleasant experience staying at Elisa's. Room was very comfortable with lots of nice touches. Very friendly! Thanks Elisa!

I had a great time at Elisa's place. She is an incredibly chilled host and I am thankful for her hospitality. The room is nice, quiet, and clean. Exactly as it looks on the picture. The house is in a nice street and near to the tube.

Before we arrived, Elisa had emailed us with precise instructions on how to get to the house, which was very helpful. The room and bathroom were very clean and looked exactly as shown. Overall, we enjoyed our 3 nights stay here and we find Elisa and Dom to be very gracious and friendly hosts. The house is located in a very convenient neighbourhood, close to lots of restaurants and shops.  The underground station is 10 min walk from the house. It is also very easy to get to Heathrow Airport by bus 283 (a mere 2 min walk from the house) to Hammersmith station to catch the train to the airport.

This is a superior option to staying at a hotel in London, especially when considering the price of London hotels.  

The place is located in lovely Chelsea, seconds away from scores of shops, restaurants and pubs.  There is also a supermarket and cinema literally right around the corner.  If your only in London a few days and are primarily sight-seeing, the place is within walking distance to two metro stations and two or three tube stops to Westminister, Soho and Southbank  (about 20 mins total time).   A really great option for quick and easy access to central London with a quieter, trendy and less tourist neighbourhood to come home too.  And for anyone traveling from North America, London public transit is an absolute dream in comparison.

The apartment itself is very cute, perfectly clean and very well out-fitted.  Everything was recieved exactly as promised in the ad.  Phillipa was a kind and helpful host.  We would definitely recommend this place.  Great visit!

Within less than 10 minutes of South Kensington and 15 minutes of Sloane Square tube stations, there are several buses even closest to the apartment such as line 14, 19 and 11 (if I remember well). Some of the buses run all night so if you want to go out and are a little low on money for the cab you can always take one f them to go home!
It is ideal if you want to do some sightseeing and party in London while living in a nice and calm area. Of course you'll have to be very quiet while coming back home because it is a residential area and that's what make it so nice. 
Lovely shop stores around on King's road, the Saatchi gallery is at 10 minutes walking, the grocery store is literally  around the corner.
Saint-Pancras station for those who take the Eurostar is in the same tube station at 45 minutes top. Most of the tourist spots are within 20 minutes.

The apartment itself is very quiet at night a little less in the morning because it is located next to a store delivery parking. No worries then close the windows turn on the air conditioner or put some ear plugs if you are like me (light sleeper) it only lasts an hour.

It is exactly as indicated in the add. Beautiful natural light that makes it very bright. Comfortable bed, clean bathroom with fresh towels and toilet paper (seems silly to point it but very useful when you arrive late and haven't got time to go to the market) and an equipped kitchen. Everything you need for your stay as a true Londoner!

Philippa is a very lovely and warm lady. I am sure she will make your stay as comfortable as ours. 
I am glad I've met her and I hope next time I'll go to London her appartment will be free for me to rent it! 

Thank you again for everything Philippa!! :)

Wonderful location! 10min stroll to the tube and as we found out, fantastic bus connections to lots of sightseeing spots of London. 
Having a well equipped kitchen and waitrose supermarket next door helps to whip up a good meal in pricy London. 
Apartment is clean and cozy. 
Philippa is very helpful and very welcoming. 
Highly recommend her apartment to all visitors looking to enjoy London for short and long stays.

Located in a convenient and central area of London, this flat is the perfect place for tourists looking for an affordable home base. Close to 2 tube stops and several bus lines, the flat is close to great shops and in a nice residential area. You'll have to be respectful of your neighbors if coming in late at night or early in the morning but it also means a peaceful time for yourself. The amenities and apartment are just as the photos and description indicate. The host is very helpful and accommodating. I'd love to stay here again on a return trip to London!

Delightful, charming hostess.  Very clean, and wonderful neighborhood.  Only one bus to the city, lots of amenities nearby, very safe area, great pubs nearby, went for evening walks, great coffee shop in the morning....Thanks Philippa!

The flat is exactly as it is shown in the photographs.
My flight in was very late; but Philippa was there to meet me at the flat; and seems a very good hostess.
As I was traveling alone, it was nice to know that she lives nearby for added security.
The building is quite secure, and the flat itself has very good locks; and also locking windows with a little separate key.
Even being on the ground floor, I felt very safe there.
I didn't mind the street noise at all, as we live on a busy street at home.
The bedroom has lovely thick curtains, so you can get a great sleep in the very comfy bed ,and not be woken up by light in the mornings.
The flat is spotless throughout, and has lots of hot water for showers.
It's got absolutely everything you would need; from hairdryer to iron, to all the kitchen equipment needed for cooking.
It's really easy to get around London from there : 
I recommend buying an Oyster Transport pass for the Tube and buses. 
I was even able to use it on a couple of regular trains.
Lots of great shops right nearby, including a wonderful large grocery store.
This was my first experience with AirBnB, though I always rent apartments when I travel;  and I was VERY pleased with it all.
Thanks, Philippa ;  for sharing your cosy home with others!
I would love to stay there on another visit!

Philippa is a wonderful host and a most charming woman - the apartment was lovely, the location perfect, the stay was completely hassle and problem free and I look forward to returning as soon as I can.
The hosts were very friendly  and helpful.  Room and bathroom were great.  Neighborhood was safe and restaurants  plentiful.

My parents came to London and needed a place to stay. I booked Philippa's apartment because I loved the position and the pictures on Airbnb. 
I arrived a day before my parents and went to Philippa to do the check in. She was amazing! So kind! 
The flat was super clean and tidy and very welcoming. I loved it at first glance!
I recommend the flat because has an extraordinary position ( it's in the heart of Chelsea, in Kings road!!!) and Philippa is an amazing host.
I definitely will rent again the flat in future!

this is a wonderful little bolt hole in the lovely area of Chelsea - very conveniently located near Kings Road and lots of public transport. Highly recommended for short or medium stays. Thanks Phillipa.

I enjoyed my stay at Phillipa's apartment.  It was within easy walking distance to the underground station and was in an attractive and upmarket part of London.  It was a bonus having Waitrose supermarket in the next street.  Although I didn't get to meet Phillipa ( she was overseas) I had regular contact with her and she was concerned that I had a pleasant stay and everything I needed.  I would recommend  the apartment for both a long or short term stay in London. 
Melanie Brown

We had a wonderful stay in Philippa's apartment. Comfortable, quiet and very clean. The aparment is in a very nice location with all types of restaurants and a Waitrose supermarket right around the corner. In a few minutes you can walk to the river, over the bridge and into Battersea park! 

I didn't get a chance to meet Philippa in person as she was abroad, but she was very friendly and helpful over the phone and via email. We had everything we needed and it was a real pleasure to stay there. Thank you Philippa!

As a solo mature aged traveller wanting to spend some time in London, it was perfect. location  as  it is a short walk (about 12 mins) to South Kensington underground which gives you access to 3 main train lines Piccadilly, District and (Website hidden by Airbnb) is also just of Kings Roads in Chelsea giving you access to everything you need for your stay in London including supermarkets,eateries, post office and a great pub around the corner called the Builders Arms. Everything for me was perfect in the apartment. Nothing was not available that I needed. Philippa is a wonderful host and had prepared the apartment ready for easy access. Everything was explained and all easy to use. I felt very secure in the apartment which is very light and airy. For me it was my perfect choice for my stay in London, made even more enjoyable in having Philippa as your host who certainly has a great apartment for one or 2 people. Many thanks. Philippa as greatly appreciate the opportunity of staying in your Chelsea pad. It is perfect

We've been traveling to 
london every year, it was our first time in Philippa's flat and it was great. Everything is perfect and the location.... We loved! Thank you Philippa!!

Very nice flat  with a lot of amenities, and it's very quiet! I stayed here for a couple of days this summer and would definitely stay again. 

Philippa was a bit hard to reach via phone / email at times, but I think I just caught her while she was doing some heavy traveling. Overall the trip worked out well and both she and Mary (a local tenant) were quite accommodating!

What a wonderful first time London experience! From the very beginning Philippa, our host, was informative, helpful and open. Philippa was unable to meet us but Mary her friend and neighbor helped us settle iin and offered us umbrellas for our rainy stay.

The apartment was wonderfully located with a supermarket, pastry shops and so many restaurants within walking distance, ie just around the corner. Ditto for public transportation - bus stop just around the corner that served us as "tour" buses since the routes went by every known site you could wish to visit. Within walking distance the Victoria and Albert museum and the Natural history musuem, the beautiful church of St. Luke with its gardens just at the end of the street.

And the apartment itself was incredibly comfortable, with a washing machine and dishwasher and enough kitchen utensils for breakfast or any other meal you would want to prepare.

The neighborhood was exceptionally  quiet  in the evening with only the routine morning noise of the city of London waking in the morning.

I recommend Philippa and her home  very highly and hope to return quite soon.

Ruth

Thank you for letting us stay in your beautiful flat. The location was excellent; you can almost see the bus stop from the front door! There is also plenty of shopping close by. The only tiny complaint we had was that apartment was on the first floor and it could be a little loud in the mornings. If you're a light sleeper, bring ear plugs. But I would definitely recommend this place!

Just as pictured - tidy, comfortable and quiet, with a nice bathroom, a well stocked kitchen, and a washer/dryer/ironing board/iron which is wonderful if you opt to stay a full week or more. With a Waitrose and an M&S both just around the corner, you'll be all set!

It's an incredibly convenient location - just off King's Road, only 10 min. walk to the South Kensington stop (near the V&A and within walking distance of Royal Albert Hall and Hyde Park, etc.) and ~10-15 min. walk to Sloan Square.  Philippa was also an excellent host, always very helpful and responsive.

We only wish we'd been able to stay another week. A wonderful value, and I'm sure we'll try to stay again the next time we're in London!

The apartment was lovely and exactly as promised. We found the location excellent -- convenient to bus and tube, with lots of shops nearby-- and all the appliances and furnishings excellent. Phillipa made checking in and out a breeze, and kindly left us some milk in the fridge, and made certain we understood how everything worked.

The only drawbacks are things the owner really couldn't control: the noise from the trucks unloading right outside in the mornings (not too bad with windows closed), and the resulting lack of air circulation at night. 

I would certainly recommend this flat to a couple looking for a clean, comfortable, well-equipped rental at a great price and in a great location!

The Bright Chelsea Apartment was just that. The flat is exactly as advertised ~ compact yet complete with everything you might need. Both of us arrived from Amsterdam a day into head colds. Philippa was kind enough to direct us to the "electric fire" she keeps tucked away so we were able to be a bit warmer on our sickest day.

Philippa is a great host making certain we knew where everything was and how it operated in the flat. We enjoyed being on the ground level for a change. Usually our accommodations  away from home seem to be on the fifth and sixth floors without lifts.

Philippa will be starting a remodeling soon so it wil be interesting to stay when she has completed that to see the changes. They undoubtedly will be stunning.

Special note: I needed to fax a document back to the States and asked Philippa about businesses that provided those such as FedEx and MailBoxes Etc. There is a MBE near the South Kensington Underground however Philippa advised that her printer should do that (wouldn't connect for me as a scanner but worked fine as a copier/printer). The alternative were free services at the Town Hall across Kings Road. I ended up at the library at that building. William helped me join the library and then made an appointment for me at the computer station that would scan my document so I could send it as an attachment to an email.

Philippa was a very friendly, warm and caring host. We arrived very early - which meant that the guest before us was still in the flat, so Pilippa showed as a nice British bar/restaurant and had (very early ;) ) lunch with us - thanks for that! :) The room was very clean, big enough for the two of us and very easy to reach via bus and metro. You need about 20 minutes by bus and about 10 minutes by metro to get to the center. 

We can only recommend this flat as accommodation and Philippa as a host!

Elisa and Dom were excellent hosts; they gave us very detailed instructions regarding directions to their house and the key exchange process. The room was just as pictured and the bathroom was clean. We were able to help ourselves to breakfast every morning! Great location - just a short train ride out into the city :)
Friendly family, nice, quiet room and a great breakfast every morning.

We had a great stay. The room was charming and tucked away at the top of the house. Our hosts were great and gave us tips on restaurants and how to get around the city. We loved the location because we saw a different part of the city and it was just a short walk to the underground and to many wonderful restaurants. It was about a 25 minute ride in the undergroud to Piccadilly Circus. The communication before our visit as well as during our visit was great as well.

Elisa and Dom have a lovely home on a quiet street, and easy to get to from the local Underground stop. There's also a bus stop nearby. I think I only heard noise from outside once but I mostly slept like a rock. The stairs are narrow so careful if you have problems with that - I did not until trying to quietly leave early in the morning. Sorry! 

Breakfast was provided in the mornings in the form of cereal, juice, tea, and yogurt, plenty enough to get you going. Elisa was kind enough to lend me her Tate Modern card to visit the museum, although I never made it over. 

I'll certainly keep this home in mind for any future visits to the city!

Our host was waiting for us, but we were delayed at customs and getting to the place since it was our first time in London.  I had no service and was unable to call them.  Once my daughter had reception we called our host to let them know we were on our way.  Our host had left instructions as to where the key was and code to get in.   Our host were very nice people and helpful, gave us tips to explore London and advise to travel to Paris.  Will definitely stay again with the William family when traveling back to the UK.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Elisa's house. Her home is conveniently located within walking distance of two tube stations, in a safe neighborhood in Shepherd's Bush. Our check-in was very easy. We arrived on a Saturday and stayed 4 nights. Saturday night there was a huge party two houses down that lasted until 1AM, but I suppose that is to be expected in such a lively area on the weekend. Saturday night was the only night with a noise issue. The other nights we had very restful sleep. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The shower pressure and temperature were good. The room and bathroom were clean and spacious. The hosts are extremely friendly and welcoming. They even provided breakfast in the morning. We would recommend this listing.

We stayed 2 nights at this B & B. What a wonderful stay! Great location, close to the tube. There are many places to eat out close by. The hosts are very gracious & helpful. The breakfast was perfect for us. We would definitely book this B & B again!

We had a very nice 3 nights stay at Elisa and Dominic’s place.
Very nice house, good location (quiet street close to the tube)
Warm welcome and very good breakfast ; we spend some time in their garden on a sunny morning
Would like to stay again.

Thanks to Elisa and Dominic (  I’m not sure Wales will make it til the end ;-) )

Our hosts were away when we arrived (which we knew would be the case) but their daughter was most welcoming and provided us with everything that we needed. The house is pretty much exactly as described in the listing. The neighbourhood was fine, very busy market area with a diverse cultural base and hence lots of options for eating out. A good laundrette very close which for us travelling was great.

We had a wonderful experience with Elisa and Don. They both are great, very pleasent and nice to talk to. Their house is also great, the room was very clean and comfortable, as well as the private bathroom. Also no complains about the breakfast! The subway is about a 10 minutes walk from the house, and we could easily access all the places we wanted to visit. As I said, it was a wonderful experience!

Philippa's flat in Chelsea is absolutely adorable. It is warm, cosy, welcoming, and simply a delightful space. In a marvellous location; a secure building;  I had a most enjoyable stay. Thank you so much!
great flat, super location, nice and cosy, would definitely stay there again!

Every thing was fine!
Great location in Chelsea! We had no problem getting the key. We had a great time and would be very likely to recommend this flat. 
Regards
Great little flat, central location, everything works.
A wonderful location. Philippa's home has everything you need & is very comfortable...feels like home. Thanks again.

Our first and very positive airbnb experience. The apt. was exactly as pictured on airbnb. No surprises and no disappointments. On arrival was clean and tidy. Key exchange went smoothly. Cozy but plenty of space for two people. Everything worked. WiFi was excellent.Communication via email with Phillipa was effortless. Location is great with easy access to stores, restaurants, buses and  underground. Neighborhood was quiet and safe. Highly recommended. Would definitely stay there again.

Wonderful location just off the Kings Rd. The flat was spotless, nicely decorated, good internet, comfy bed, plenty of hot water,small, but very well equipped kitchen. Good ground floor location so no need to lug luggage up stairs for us elderly folk. Philippa was a great host- answered all my questions promptly. Hope to stay there again.

We had a very comfortable stay in Chelsea Manor Street. Close to transport and all the things we wanted to do. Really nice to feel that we were at home. Philippa was overseas when we were there but arranged key pickup and answered our questions promptly.
It was a great two week spend at the place. Great location and everything you need to fell boom away from home.

Lovely apartment, great location, clean. Nice area, King's Road round the corner. 2 Minutes to busstop. Hardly any traffic in the street. Some noise early in the morning (Waitrose is very near), but it would be difficult to find a more quiet place so central in London. Good communication with Philippa.

This Chelsea apartment is a great place for visiting London. It is perfectly located, with King's Road shops around the corner, buses going in all directions, and half way between two tube stations.
The apartment is sunny and cosy and very easy to live in.
Philippa is just an email away. It is a secure building.
We toured all over London from here.

First time on Airbnb,

Philippa was very kind, welcoming and accomodating.
The flat is lovely, and as clean and quiet as said in the comments.
The location was perfect, next to underground station on the main lines.

We had there a wonderful time, and would be happy to stay there again !

This was my first time using Airbnb and I can only hope that future rentals are this positive. 

Excellent apartment and exactly as described in the listing, down to the nice pub around the corner and the very relaxing gardens at St. Luke's. Safe, vibrant neighborhood and the location can't be beat. Bus stops right around the corner, underground stations a 3 minute bus ride or 10 minute walk away. Full service market also right around the corner. Several eating choices within a short walk.  The apartment was warm and cozy and had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. 

Philippa was an outstanding host. Once we booked she provided us a wealth of information on the apartment and the neighborhood to get us orientated and despite the late hour of our arrival she was there to meet us and get us settled. The apartment has internet and Philippa had a number of maps and guides to help plan our London vacation. If relaxing with a good book is on the agenda, she has a nice assortment to choose from. 

All-in-all a five star experience. I would not hesitate to recommend Philippa's apartment to my friends.
Nice host, tidy and well-equipped apartment, great location.

This was our first BnB experience and we were very pleased.  The apartment was clean and comfortable and the owner was very friendly and helpful.  A delightful lady from upstairs made our stay more enjoyable and managed a maintenance issue while we were out.  Location was excellent, directly on the bus lines and short walks to two tube stations.  Many food/pub choices minutes away and the Waitrose market was just around the corner.  We felt totally comfortable with the neighborhood and although we were on a first floor, it was actually very quiet and we slept well.  Starts to get a little noisy some mornings at 8, but we were well on on way to heading out for the morning.  We appreciated the absolute absence of smoke in the apartment.  I can easily recommend this apartment and location to anyone!

Philippa’s little apartment was perfect for my week’s stay in London. Very well located and very accessible to public transport, pubs and restaurants. All amenities were readily at hand. If only I had realised that there was an air conditioning unit above front door before my last days stay, especially as London probably experienced its hottest days of the summer during my stay! I would certainly recommend this apartment and hope to stay there on my next London trip. Mike

A small flat off the Kings Road in Chelsea which we took for a month.  Probably a bit small for a full month (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) minutes walk from Sloane Square it is a good position save for one glaring fault.  It is on the corner of Hemus Place (see (Hidden by Airbnb) street view) which contains the loading docks and delivery areas for Habitat and Waitrose and the trucks can start form 6:00 AM some mornings and 7:00 AM most!  A sleep in is not an option. A minor but inconvenient matter was the dish washer was non functional when we arrived and as the owner was overseas nothing could be done.    Generally satisfactory!

A wonderful place to stay in London! It was easy to get to anywhere in London, situated between South Kensington and Sloane Square Tube stops. The first day we walked from the apartment to Westminister Abbey and Parliament. We loved the area, the walk along Kings Rd was one we did often and will miss. The flat was well appointed and Philippa gave us a thorough introduction to everything in the apartment before she left. Great food stores nearby, Waitrose and M&S.  If we go back to London we would want to stay here again.

We had a wonderful stay at this flat in July 2015. The flat was clean, close to amenities (including the Nottinghill Tube station) and Chili was a great host. We especially enjoyed that the flat was within walking distance of Kennington gardens and Hyde park which are great places for running and walking. I highly recommend this as a place to stay in London.

My friend and I enjoyed the time in our Notting Hill flat.  This is a lovely location and we really enjoyed having a glass of wine at night on the terrace.  The place had all the basics and was clean - and being July, we used the portable fan a lot!

Great location, right in heart of Notting Hill/Portobello Rd. 5 mins to Kensington Park Gardens. Well equipped flat with the added bonus of sun terrace. Small bedroom, tight for 2 people. Noise (traffic/people) may be an issue for some, though remember you're in the thick of it. Chil excellent with all comms.

Our first impressions were a bit mixed. The apartment is adequately furnished and equipped but no more. The lack of a wardrobe or any clothes storing facilities means you really have to live out of your suitcases. However, the large living room gives you plenty of room to spread out so we found it quite satisfactory.  And you can do laundry which is great. As other reviewers have mentioned, the area is quite noisy with buses passing very regularly until late evening. But we found it exciting rather than annoying. And we loved the outdoor "rooftop" area which we used both day and night as we had good weather.
Whatever the real or perceived faults of the apartment the location is excellent, close to Portobello Road, within a short walk of Kensington Gardens and just around the corner from Notting Hill Gate tube station. It's a great place to live.

Chil was very quick in replying to my questions. The flat is literally 1 min from the Notting Hill tube stop, so that means there's lots of foot traffic and cars whizzing by. The living room is nice and airy. There is no tv. There is a washer but no dryer. The flat was clean, but the bed was lumpy. Half way through, we ended up sleeping on the sofa because my husband's back was hurting. Other than the bed, everything was very nice. Thank you for hosting us, Chil.

Thomas and I had a wonderful time in Chils lovely Notting Hill Flat. 

It's a super cool and trendy little flat right in the hart of Notting Hill only minutes away from Portobello Rd. plus the Central line if you wanna go anywhere else in London. The rooftop terrace is absolutely fabulous, and much bigger that what it looks like in the pictures.  

Right across the street there's a Starbucks which we visited for breakfast every day;)  

Chils was a great host - communication was good all the way from booking to departure, and she made us feel very welcome although we didn't actually get a chance to meet.

I would definitely reccomend staying at Chils falt if you're visiting the area - I will most certainly try to book it when I come back to London the next time.

Really lovely flat - location is brilliant, great for exploring London as it is a short walk home from the tube rather than a long journey through many streets as can easily be the case in London.
Flat needed to be cleaned when we arrived, which wasn't a problem as we were told in advance and the cleaner did a good job whilst we had a couple of beers across the street.
Flat as described - a cosy one bedroom, well equipped, milk in the fridge and coffee in the cupboard, nice living room looking out onto the bustling street below, a lovely roof terrace for evening drinks and breakfast overlooking some lovely streets, and a comfortable bed tucked away in the quieter part of the flat.
Best thing about the place is the location - we came to explore London, not the apartment we stayed in, and being less than a minute walk to both Notting Hill Gate tube station on one side and Portobello Road in the other direction made this the ideal place for us. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting to get the most out of their trip to London!

Chil was a wonderful host. She was quick to respond to my messages. She even arranged for us to check in early. When we were late for the check in, due to a huge line in customs, Chil was very understanding! The flat itself was incredible! The location is so close to a tube stop connecting to several lines. It was very clean and stocked with the essentials- including fresh milk. We loved eating out on the back patio. There were some cute places to eat as well as markets close by!

The experience was excellent, the city is lovely and I couldn't expect more. The flat is really awesome, very well located (2 minutes walking to Nothing Hill gate) and there are many places to go around it (supermarkets, stores and a Starbucks just in front of the apartment!). Wrapping up, if I have to go to London again, I would not doubt to lodge in Chil's flat again.

We are newlyweds having our honeymoon in London 3 days after our wedding. We stayed here for 5 nights in Sep/Oct 2015. Due to our busy planning for the wedding the week before, we only finalized our check-in details 2 days prior. We arrived at the unit at 10am and were greeted by Chil's cleaner who briefly showed us around the house. What we loved most is the location to the tube (about 2 mins walk). We also liked the lounge area which had heaters and comfy couch and the terrace because we can have hot meals outdoors and enjoy the lovely breeze (something we don't get in Malaysia). The pantry is quite well equipped with a working oven and microwave and they have a nice medium sized fridge. We happened to be able to enjoy the 'Indian summer' during our stay. What we didn't like were the bedroom because it didn't have heater so it was quite chilly all the time and traffic noise (loudest from 8am - 10pm) because the unit is located at the intersection of 2 busy roads. Also, the pillow cases from the bedroom had a musty smell. Overall, it was a cosy stay for a holiday but not really for honeymoon because the bedroom was too chilly for us to sleep in (maybe it was autumn and we are not used to the cool weather).
Chil flat is exactly as described. It is a great location and the outside roof deck is a wonderful feature. Chil was very responsive and helpful.

Chil was easy to contact and flexible about our arrival and departure times. The apartment is in an amazing location with Notting Hill Gate tube station 2 mins away. The apartment was clean and comfortable size for the two of us with a really beautiful balcony when the weather is nice. We would definitely stay here in the future! Thanks Chil!
Great location - close to the tube station, shops, and Kensington palace.  Apartment was clean and satisfactory, the deck was awesome. Chil was a wonderful hostess, very helpful and accommodating.

Chili was very nice and always checked in to see everything was okay. Apartment was very clean and a fantastic location!
I would stay there again for sure!

Host was accessible when needed, place was as described. Some reviews said noisy? Bedroom is in the back so I didn't see how it could be noisy. Maybe if you have all the windows open? It was fine!! We would gladly stay there again. Utterly convenient for two people .

Chil was very prompt in responding and checking if things were OK and everything went smoothly . 
The  apt was in a great location and easy access to city 
I was dissapoointed the  host decided to charge extra for my son to sleep on sofa bed as she said it was for laundry but there was an awful damp musty smell in the place which we checked out on last day and there were soaking wet towels and sheets hanging in the cupboard - not great for anyone with asthma and made room feel damp . We had a lovely time and apt was as described but I wouldn't stay again because of the damp but it's a lovely little place

Hi Chil
Thank you very much for a wonderful stay in your nice appartment. We enjoyed it very much. It is very well situated and so easy to get around in London from here. 
We will recommend this nice place!! 
Best wishes
Lone & Thomas

We spent a long weekend in London and enjoyed our stay in Chil's apartment very much.
The location is unbeatable and anyone who has ever been to Notting Hill before and loves wandering around that part of the city will know this by looking it up on a map. Also, Notting Hill Gate as one major station to explore the center of London is just a few steps away.
The apartment itself is nice and offers anything you need: a nice place to sit in the living area (actually quite big for London), a kitchen with all general supplies, a small bedroom which is in the back of the apartment, not directly facing the street and a clean bathroom. We stayed there during Pre-Christmas Season, so we did not really use the balcony but we could image the highlight of sitting up there during warmer days and watch people in the streets.
Chil was really easy and quick in communication, no problems at all. 
For our next visit, we'd definitely consider coming back to this place.

This was our first experience in renting an apartment through Airbnb. Chil’s immediate responses throughout the booking process and that continued until the day we arrived in London on late evening eve of Christmas impressed us. The apartment is exactly as described and shown:- clean and neat, 1 min walk to Notting Hill Gate metro station. Tesco, M&S and everything we need was within 5 - 10 mins walk. Plus point that it is located near the famous Portobello district, lending lively and safe atmosphere. The kitchen is equipped with almost all utensils and crockeries. Chil had prepared the necessity like cereal, milk, floor, oil etc. A saviour as all shops and transportations were closed on Christmas Day. We are thankful for her kind gesture.
We spent our daily morning coffee at the beautiful patio while watching the dark winter sky cleared up. It was a nice addition to the memorable stay.
The only downside is the small bedroom. The room is without closet or space to fit our clothes except for the 3 drawers. With limited storage space, we left most of our clothes in the suitcases in the  living room. The angle of the bed is quite awkward that the one sleeping nearer to the wall has to crawl in or out from the side of bed when the other is sleeping. However, Chil made up for it all with her thoughtfulness. We would certainly stay in the apartment again in future. Thank you.
The flat was in an excellent location, very close to the tube. It included all of the basic amenities and was just cleaned before we arrived. We would definitely return to this place! Thanks Chil!

The flat was great. I stayed with 1 other friend and the split level gave us each our own space. The location was very convenient, right around the corner from the Notting Hill Gate tube station. Check in/out was easy. There was a bit of street noise, as earlier reviews suggested. If you're not sleeping in the living room and are only using the bedroom you won't hear it. If you plan on using the couch in the living room it may bother you a bit but it is just traffic noise.

Philippa is a lovely hostess and very accommodating. The flat was just as described, and was perfect for my 2-week venture in London. Philippa's flat is very comfortable and private, and close to all amenities. I would definitely recommend it as a great place to stay while exploring London.
Nice friendly welcome from Philippa, great compact flat in good location.

As previously arranged, we contacted Philippa when we arrived at the neighborhood Tube Station in London, and then met her in person at her flat just a few minutes later. She gave us a very thorough introduction to all aspects such as Kitchen, laundry, garbage, etc and welcomed any questions that we had. The flat and location were exactly as described in the listing, and, in fact, exceeded it.
Great flat and perfectly placed! Philippa was wonderful and explained everything in detail. We felt very welcome and safe there.
The flat is very comfortable, clean and in a wonderful area. We felt (Email hidden by Airbnb) munication with Philippa was easy and she was very helpful and accommodating. We had a great stay.

This is a perfect location for museums the V and A and the Natural History Museum. The 211 bus got me to Victoria Station in minutes; everything I needed close by - truly a comfortable, safe and pleasant venue for my solo city break.

Phillipa's apartment is clean, comfortable, well equipped, filled with natural light, and very well located. Very suitable for 1 person or a couple. As other reviewers have noted, it is behind the loading docks of two shops BUT double glazed windows throughout and heavy curtains in the bedroom minimised noise and light, with no problem for me on a morning I wished to sleep in. With a fan in the bedroom, air conditioning in the central hall and heating throughout, this would be a comfortable choice in any season. Ground floor location gives it convenient access with the Kings Rd - and buses - within 2 min. walk and tube within 12 min walk.

Philippa's apartment was wonderful!! It was cozy and charming and in the best location. Communication with her was perfect and we found the place easily. She provided detailed instructions for everything in the apartment. We felt very at home.

We booked the flat for 4 days in early July. Communication with Phillipa was excellent prior to our arrival. Unfortunately, we did not meet either Phillipa or any other person during our stay. Fortunately, we were able to get to the keys and successfully enter the apartment. The apartment itself was nice and comfortable. The location has its good and bad points. First the good - because of its location near a lot of nice shopping and restaurants (including a supermarket, Waitrose, nearby) our stay was comfortable. The number 11 bus which stops nearby takes you to within 15 minutes walking of most major sights. The bad thing about the location is it is right behind the Waitrose. ON our first morning we were woken up early by a lot of delivery truck noise. The dumpsters nearby are also a bit of an eyesore. But we kept the curtains drawn and were out most of the day so those things were soon forgotten. Overall we were pleased with our stay.

We had a wonderful stay at Philippa's cozy flat. It was perfectly located for our purposes, close to transportation, very comfortable, clean and easy to feel at home. 
In terms of what matters to us, the kitchen had what we needed, the shower was strong, the bed comfortable, and the AC worked well. 
Communication with Philippa was pleasant, instructions were clear, and Mary was very nice when we arrived later than expected due to tube strike. 
All in all, a terrific experience. We would definitely stay again and recommend highly to others. 
Thank you, Philippa!

Philippa was very responsive to all communication and very thorough in her descriptions about how everything worked. She was not in the country during our stay but it is pretty much a turn key operation and there was a neighbor who we could have contacted if necessary. The apartment is as pictured and described on the website. Great neighborhood with excellent shopping dining and lots of pubs and clubs. little bit of a walk to the subway, but there are buses, taxis and uber so we had no trouble getting around. The apartment has all of the conveniences you could need or want. Dishwasher, washer and dryer and Air conditioning unit and all worked flawlessly. We would definitely stay here again.
Our stay of 6 days in London at Philippa's apartment was very successful. The Apartment was as advised and being just off Kings Road was ideal. We would definitely use it again.

I had an excellent stay in Philippa's flat. Although she was away when we arrived, she made arrangements for us to acquire the keys and receive a tour of the apartment. The flat is so cute, perfect for 1 or a couple.

The apartment is located in a lovely neighbourhood, with many excellent bars and restaurants as well as 2 underground stations within in walking distance. We had no issues getting around the city while staying based in Chelsea.

I stayed in Philippa's apartment for a week while in London on business. The apartment was perfect for me. It had everything I wanted, it was very clean and tidy, the shower was terrific, it was handy to public transport, it was on the ground floor but very safe and secure. I will certainly try to stay here the next time I am in London.
The flat is amazing. Its close to the bus stop and just a minute walk to all the pubs. I would recommend this apartment to anyone who want to stay in Chelsea.

Good communication prior to arrival and Phillipa was there to welcome us despite late plane. Our second stay at her apt. Great location close to two tube stations, restaurants, shopping and a grocery store around the corner if you want to cook. Fully equipped. Beautiful little church park at the end of the street. Great place from which to explore London.

I cannot recommend this flat highly enough. It was lovely, clean, easy check-in and -out, excellent location; everything you could hope for. Honestly, stop your search and stay here. It's the perfect slice of London life and British hospitality provided by Philippa.
Perfectly located to explore London city at its best!
The listing was accurate.

Elisa & Dom have a lovely large family home in a very quiet street which is only a stone’s throw from the main street, not far from the Market & public transport.  They are lovely people and made us feel most welcome.  
The room is homely & light & has a brilliantly comfortable bed.  The private bathroom next door is great. 
We particularly liked the Queen Adelaide which was vibrant & good beer & wine.  We also ate at the Aiyam Daman – excellent food, very welcoming.  Visit the market - you can buy just about anything!  
Many thanks

Elisa and Dom were kind and hospitable hosts. The room was small, private and quiet and bathroom was next to bedroom.  Bed was comfortable and rooms clean and charming. Easy checkin and check out process. House close to bus and relatively close to tube. Nice visit!

We had a great first AirBnB experience at Elisa and Dom's house.
They are very lovely, helpful and welcoming people. The house is beautiful and cosy. Our room and the private bathroom were bright, clean and furnished with a great taste. The logistics concerning picking up the key or storaging our luggage early were no problem at all and easily handled. I had very nice talks with them.
The breakfast was very good and rich. 
All in all a great first AirBnB experience in London. 
We recommend them warmly and would stay there again for sure.

Elisa and Dom are very gentle people. We arrived before the check-in time, but she made and effort to check us in, and everything was ready. Everyday had a nice breakfast with espressos, milk, yogurt, cereals, breads... The tube is about 500 meters from home. 
We didn't see them everyday, but if you needed something was just sending a msg by airbnb app and they replied as fast as you can imagine.
The only thing we didn't feel comfortable is that the floor makes wood noise, and this may bother a little bit, specially at night. I have to use toilette and that made me very afraid to woke up someone. But it's a small thing compared to the nice experience we had. 
We definitely will come back if we go again to London.

We received a very warm welcome indeed from Elisa, Dom and family. The whole family are really friendly and chilled out, which immediately put us at ease. 
The house is beautiful, and our room and bathroom were lovely, spacious and spotlessly clean. The shower is great!
We were so surprised at how quiet it was considering the house is within spitting distance of Shepherds Bush High Street, which is full of bars, restaurants, shops and people. But the only noise we heard from our bedroom was a nightingale and the dawn chorus so no complaints there.
We really liked the location, as it has excellent transport links to anywhere in London and a great variety of choice for food/drinks, but without the droves of tourists you can expect to encounter closer to the centre. 
Breakfast is a really informal affair with a choice of porridge, muesli/granola, yoghurts, lovely breads and preserves, juice and a wide selection of teas and coffees. You just help yourself and have a natter with however is around!
We really enjoyed our stay with Elisa and Dom and hope to go back soon. The accommodation is great value for money and the hosts are really warm, lovely people. A definite 10/10.

We didn't see Elisa and Dom a lot because we were busy but everything was perfect!
The house is very nice and the room very comfy and quiet. The bathroom is perfectly clean and it was great to have our own one.
We really loved to have breakfast in this amazing kitchen... 
We know where to stay for our next visit in London...

We really had a pleasant holiday at Elisa's home.
She and her family have been very gentle.
The room is very large and beatiful.
we had a very pleasant experience at Elisa's home.Her family are lovely and it was great to get breakfast and have a chat with Dom.Thankyou

Dom and Elisa were very welcoming and their home is charming and very well situated to get around London with the closest tube station only a 5 minute walk.  The room was charming and private, and we felt very comfortable and at home.  Out hosts were very informative when it came to finding out what was on in London and where the local restaurants are.  Experienced AirBandB'ers who made us newbies very welcome.  Thank you guys, Rachel and Keith

We enjoyed our stay. ELISA and her husband were warm, friendly and helpful hosts. They have a gorgeous home, and our room was delightful, warm and cosy and a comfy bed. The whole house was warm and comfortable which is much appreciated as we stayed during a cold February. The breakfast was wholesome, and tasty. The location is so easy for exploring London. The tube is 7 mins easy walk away, there are many restaurants and cafes  a few minutes walk away. We felt very safe. The house is situated in a quiet road, with no traffic noise. Would definetly stay again. The description is on Airbnb is accurate, in fact even nicer than we thought, this was due to the warmth of the hosts.

Very pleasant experience for 2 night's stay. This place is so convenient - 5 mins walking from the Shepherd's Bush Market tube station (note - not Shepherd 's Bush station) on the City & Hammersmith Line. Walking distance to the Westfield Shopping mall. And in close vicinity to so many multi cuisine eateries. We did not meet Dom, but Elisa was kind and welcoming. The room is on the 2nd floor and this is an ancient house. But we had private bathroom - and this was great value for money. The hosts served breakfast in the very well appointed kitchen. Will have no hesitation in staying again.

Elisa's home was awesome. Really cozy, calm and perfect to relax in after a day in town.
Elisa is a wonderful host and she let us leave our baggages at her's after our checkout for a last trip to the town center.

Breakfast was also really good, with homemade marmelade, tea, milk, cereals... anything

We'll definetly want to come back!

Good communication before arrival and answered any questions I had quickly. Very friendly and helpful when we met our hosts. Listing well described and really enjoyed staying in this beautiful, cosy and quiet home. Nice choices for breakfast which were ready for us to help ourselves. Handy books/leaflets about London in our room. Good location as it was near bus stops/tube station/shops but in a peaceful street.

It was an excellent week, the appartement is very well located to visit London, 10 min from the Tube, the breakfast was correct, It was a very calm place. Elisa and Dom answer to all of our questions about the Town, they was pleasant!  We recommend this room!

Elisa and Dom are very welcoming and helpful hosts.
Our flight was delyed so we arrived very late in the evening, but it was no problem fot them.  Communication was good and very quick.
The room itself was cosy, quiet and clean, equipped with a comfortable bed. Breakfast was served daily in form of bagels, cereals and croissants as well as orange juice and coffee.
All in all it was a great stay and we will definitely visit again.

Elisa and Dom were great hosts. We met them the evening we came and they gave us really good advices what to do. The next day they went off to Scotland but the children were at home and prepared everything we needed for breakfast. The house and the room were cozy and comfortable and had everything we needed.
Every place we visited was easy to reach and it didn´t take too much time to get there. In the evenings we stayed in Shepherds Bush where we also found nice places to eat or to listen to music. All the recommendations Elisa and Dom gave us where really helpful and we enjoyed walking around areas where not only tourists go. (e.g. Hammersmith).
We had an excellent time and would surely come again and stay again at Elisa’s and Dom´s. Thanks a lot for the hospitality.

Both my girlfriend and I felt very welcome. The room was exactly like shown on the website. Elisa and Dom own a very nice house in a diverse neighbourhood close to an underground station which makes it super easy to go further into the city or get to the airport. There is a nice cafe around the corner which we went to for breakfast one morning.

Elisa and Dom are good and experienced hosts. They (fortunately found my husband's passports he had left behind, for which we are extremely grateful! The room is comfortable though the small size required a bit of adjustment as you remember how space is at a premium in London- especially when you have big suitcases! Breakfast is also great!

Elisa and Dom's place was great. We stayed 2 nights and it was the perfect quiet place after a long, busy day in the city. It isn't near central London but it is just a quick tube ride and a short walk and you are there! They provided breakfast and allowed us to check in early and leave our bags at the house so we could begine exploring London. I highly recommend staying at their lovely home.

Elisa & Dom are really nice people. They always responded immediately so communication went really well. Their home was really cosy and clean. We felt really welcome there so I would certainly recommend this place!

When we arrived we were met by Elisa's daughter and made to feel very welcome. I met Dom the next morning and we we had a nice conversation. This made me feel right at home. Elisa was very warm and friendly, she was a great help to me. Elisa was very helpful with directions and made it very easy to get around London. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was ready and well stocked every morning. They are a great couple and I only wish I had more time to visit with them.

Elisa and Dom are lovely people, they made us feel very welcome.  They were extremely helpful to us in seeking medical attention for an injury I sustained while walking in Central London during our stay with them.  We had the opportunity to visit with them both and enjoyed our conversations with them.  The neighborhood was on a quiet street, the walk to the tube was on a very different street which was lined with a variety of ethnic shops and restaurants.   The included breakfast items were especially appreciated as it allowed us to get an earlier start on our adventures each day.  We would highly recommend to anyone to stay in their home.
Welcoming, lovely people. Great location
Not applicable
We had a wonderful stay, the room and bathroom were clean and very comfortable. Elisa and Dom were lovely and we're always available and very eager to help!!!
We felt very welcome when we arrived and throughout the stay. Breakfast was on the table every morning when we woke up. Very nice couple.
The house is well-decorated. The bed is very comfortable. Elisa is a very active and friendly host. Me and my wife had a really great time in London. Hopefully we can come back in the future!

This is our second visit with Dom and Elisa within an extended trip to the UK and France. It was just as delightful as the first. The room is spacious and has access to a private bath. Their town home located on a quiet street in Shepherd's Bush neighborhood is centrally located and easily accessible to the tube and bus lines. A continental breakfast consisting of  cereals, yogurt, fruits,breads, and jams is available every morning. Dom and Elisa are the consummate hosts. They are friendly, warm, and know how to make their guests feel welcome and comfortable at all times. We thoroughly enjoyed sharing our travel experiences with them on our last night in London. Their home will be our first option on any future trips to London

Elisa and Dom were very welcoming, it felt like a home away from home. Cosy, clean and good space for a couple. The location is great, surprisingly quiet and close to lots of good restaurants and links to the West End & Centre. 

Elisa and Dom offered great advice about parking, as we took our car with us (park at Westfields if you take your car!), were very friendly and felt more like friends than hosts. 

My husband and I would love to visit again!

My room at the top of the house was quiet and calm; a good breakfast was waiting on the table every morning, however early I got up. From the house, in a remarkably quiet street, it's only a  6-10 minute walk along the lively main road to the two tube stations - an excellent location. I am a Londoner born and bred and this is the proper London experience. I much enjoyed my four nights' stay at Elisa and Dom's. They are such relaxed and open people. It was my first visit and I'll not hesitate to stay again.

Elisa and Dom made me feel safe, comfortable and cared for. Staying at their place was a lovely experience, to be recommended to anyone traveling to London for business or jolly. Their place is homely and lived in as well as private and quiet. Having your own bathroom is a real bonus. They also generously catered for my dietary preferences, providing a great breakfast, as well as help-yourself tea n coffee.

We had an amazing stay at Elisa & Dom's in Shepherds Bush! The room and bathroom was so cosy, clean, and homely. Everything was well organised and prepared for our arrival and Elisa & Dom were extremely friendly and lovely. The breakfast they provided every morning was also delicious! We couldn't have asked for more. I highly recommend staying here, it has definitely been our best Airbnb experience so far.
Great friendly place to stay. Hosts were very friendly and helpful.

Great choice for getting to know a part of London that is notvon the tourist trail but worth getting to know. Location manages to be secluded,quiet, yet near any kind of entertainment you may want. Elisa and Dom were great hosts. Lots of breakfast choice available every morning.

I loved my 6-night stay at this adorable apartment! It's compact but just right for just one person. It was also an extremely convenient 2-minute walk to my office along with a variety of shops, restaurants, and pubs. The ground floor location was a bit strange at first, as I felt that people on the street could see me in the apartment, but it ended up not being an issue (just make sure to close the curtains when you need to). It also can get a little noisy, but my sleep wasn't very disturbed. Overall, a tremendous value for apartment quality and location.

It was a very nice stay. The apartment is exactly as described and has everything you could possibly need. We didn't get to meet Philippa but we could communicate and arrange everything for our arrival and departure. The  shower pressure was really good, we had lots of towels and the kitchen was more than fully equiped. There's a supermarket just around the corner which is great. The street is a bit noisy sometimes early in the morning. We would definitely choose this apartment again if we visited London.

You MUST stay here! I cannot recommend this place enough. Communication with Philippa before we arrived was great, and the instructions to get into the flat were simple and clear. After we arrived, we received a welcome e-mail from her, and although she was not in London at the time, we were able to reach out to her neighbour if we needed anything (which we did not). The flat had everything we needed, and was the perfect size for a couple. It was on the ground floor, which was a bit nerve-wracking at first, but we were able to close the curtains and felt very safe and secure in the building. 

Chelsea is a very posh area and we felt very safe, even when coming home at 1AM in the morning one night. It is close to so many restaurants, great shopping, and is a 10 minute walk from the tube. It was also a great home base for sightseeing - we frequently only had to take one line (Circle/District) to get where we needed to go. 

I would definitely stay here again.

A wonderful find, just off the King's Road. Compact but with everything that you possibly want and more. What's more, the host kept in touch to the extent that she was mid Atlantic when she became aware of the heat wave we were enjoying and e-mailed me to remind me of the air conditioning unit. Service indeed. Would I stay there again? Yes! Would I recommend it to friends? Ofcourse!

We knew the area well, so knew how convenient the location is. Everything at your fingertips. 
There was a bit of noise during the day with local construction, but we were out most of the day so it wasn't an issue. The flat is small but cute, and had everything you would need. Highly recommend.

What a great location! Super convenient, clean with a comfortable bed, luxurious linens and a super host. Our only regret is that we didn't get to meet Philippa as she was traveling- but she has a great system for check-in when she is traveling. We felt safe in the neighborhood and found a great breakfast place a few steps away... Nells. Tell them "San Diego" sent you!!
This place is perfect for someone needing a home away from home. It is very convenient to everything in Chelsea and Kensington

Super! 
Nice apartment, Chelsea is a fantastic Place to stay.
Everything close: bus, supermarket, and restaurant.
The home is lovely and very clean, there is allora inside.

Thank' for all Philippa
Beautiful place, close to everything!!
Excellent host. Convenient and comfortable apartment. I will plan future trips here if possible.
Philippa was lovely and the flat's location was excellent - so close to the shops on the King's Road and an easy walk to the Tube. It's the perfect base for a solo traveler or a couple.
Philippa's flat is amazing!  So close to the bus, tube, grocery store and restaurants.  Very comfortable, fabulous amenities, and easy check in.  We would definitely stay at her place again.

The room is exactly like the photo - pretty, cosy and lots of light! Elisa and Dom have a beautiful house. I loved how they decorated the place and enjoyed having breakfast in their lovely kitchen/dining room. The breakfast was way better than some hotels. Elisa and Dom are very friendly & lovely people. I wish I could stay there longer!

Thank you to Elisa and Dom for your hospitality during our London stay. They are lovely hosts who care about their guests. Breakfast was laid out each morning with beautiful breads. Dom's homemade marmalade was a highlight! The cosy bedroom and bathroom were a private getaway from busy London, great for 1 or 2 guests. The Shepherd's Bush area was great for food, access to public transport and is a very quiet neighborhood off the main street. Their extremely comprehensive guidebook helped us find everything we could need in the area. Thank you Elisa and Dom!

With Elisa & Dom everything was super easy. They were very communicative and checking in was no problem.

They gave us very helpful tips. They're very friendly and open. We felt like visiting relatives :) . They respected our privacy and made us feel very comfortable.

Breakfast is superb! They're very caring!

Perfect hosts.

It was my second stay with Elisa and Dom and it was perfect - like the first time. I love the house. It is super cosy and welcoming and it is close to Shepherds Bush/Notting Hill.
Elisa and Dom are great hosts. Friendly and openminded and hearted.
I can truly recommend this house/room to everyone.
Elisa & Dom are very friendly and open. They gave us very helpful tips. Breakfast was nice. They ars very caring and they made us feel comfortable. :)

Elisa and Dom are great hosts - full of local knowledge about London. 
Their home is a fantastic place - homely and welcoming, well-equipped and also a peaceful and relaxing place
Warm and comfortable on cold nights and relaxed and friendly hosts.
Elisa and Dom are friendly people with a nice house. The room is on a separate level which allows privacy. It is a short walk to shops and amenities. Great for people who like their privacy.

Elisa welcomed us when we checked in and gave us hot tea that makes us feel warm. Breakfast was really great!! We enjoyed having fresh breakfast in her cozy kitchen. Location was very convenient, too. We had great trip thanks to Elisa :)

We had a great experience at Elisa & Dom's place and we would most definitely recommend it. It was very clean and we had everything that we wanted.

Elisa had got in glutenfree bread  for us which was most appreciated. And most delicious in combination with Dom's marmelade :-)

It was easy to get to with public transport and great as a base for exploring London.

We will definitely be back!
Elisa & Dom's place is delightful on the whole.  A tastefully furnished and decorated room which was a pleasure to return to and awake in within a house brimming with family life.

A lovely welcoming couple and comfortable home, breakfast was a lovely touch and we had freedom to come and go as we pleased. Parking was easy and access from the motorway was quick. A safe quiet street with good access to public transport. We'll be back again soon.

Dom and Elisa are great hosts. We enjoyed our daily chats about family life in Shepherds Bush and sharing stories about our children.  They were extremely helpful with any public transportation questions, especially since I was too claustrophobic to be comfortable using the underground tube system.  We followed through with Elisa 's suggestion to visit Kew Gardens, which is easy to get to by bus, and very pretty,even in mid April.  Their suggestions for good neighborhood restaurants was excellent- great Thai foodat their favorite place.  Our bed was very comfortable, room was small but adequate. Very convenient to have our own private bathroom right next door.  Wifi connection was not good in our room, so we spent some time in the kitchen checking things out on our cellphones and iPads while munching on the many fruits, yogurts, and granola available for us.  Best part of our stay was the many conversations we had with Elisa and Dom.

Elisa and Dom are terrific hosts, personable, generous, valuable resources, hospitable.  We couldn't have asked for better orientation to the neighborhood.  We would definitely recommend them and this listing.
The apartment is in the heart of Notting Hill. Super value for the money! The host has been extremely nice and quickly in replying. Overall a very good choice.

Unfortunately we were very disappointed with the apartment and checked out early the next morning. 
Whilst yes it's in a great location. Location isn't everything when your on holiday. 
Our experience at Chil's flat was horrible in particular, the bed is very uncomfortable and there is a very unpleasant stench of mould or mildew in and around the bed, the sheets and duvet, and especially the pillows. The pillows were in fact, putrid and stained. The bath towels are very old and smelly. Perhaps it is mould or something else, but the fact was we simply could not sleep here, which means we cannot rest and enjoy our holidays, and so we made alternative arrangements.

Chil was abroad during my stay however made accessing the apartment easy (scheduled key pickup with her cleaning lady) and left a detailed note for house rules. The apartment was clean, tidy and in a great location (very close to the Notting Hill Gate tube stop as well as a walk away from Portabello Road). During my stay the heating system was on the fritz and had some issues with hot water and the temperature in the apt, however Chil was always available via email and Whats App to communicate with. She had her handy man come to the apt the very next morning to work on the boiler system and was able to fix the hot water issue. Chil even offered me a partial refund for the heating issues. I would definitely choose to come back and stay here for future London trips despite some of the small hiccups.

We had a great time in London and Chil's flat! Although it was a little smaller and 'darker' (especially the bedroom was quite small) than we'd thought, we did enjoy it! Location is perfect, we loved Notting Hill. Cause we slept in the bedroom and not the living room, we weren't bothered by any outdoor noises. The bed however, was a little bit old, hard and bumpy. But overall we liked the place!

Had a wonderful weekend in London and Chil's apartment was beautifully located for the purpose. It was clean, bright and very welcoming. We were met by Chil's cleaner who even waited for us as we hit so much traffic coming into London. Many Thanks

A very cosy little apartment! Key handover was very quickly (with cleaing lady, time was communicated in advance). We really enjoyed it... the little terrace was the icing on a cake! Last but not least, the neighbourhood "Notting Hill" is just stunning. Sadly, we had to check out early (8 am)

Chil was responsive and we had no problems getting into the apartment. The place is very much in the thick of things so you have to park down the street to unload your luggage if you have a lot. The tube and buses as well as Hyde Park are all very close. The apartment, unfortunately, was not cleaned to our standards. Dishes were dirty, sheets were smelly, towels were crunchy.  The floor in the living area literally shakes when buses drive by. The bedroom is dark and sort of dingy feeling. The mattress is like an empty box with springs in it. It literally felt like a trampoline. The bathroom is nice and bright but the shower never got hot so we had to take baths. One night, a group of guys were hanging out in an apartment or store, not sure what type of place, but it was literally right underneath the bedroom and we could hear their conversations as though they were standing in the room with us. The "fresh" milk in the fridge was expired and there were rotting limes in the fridge as well. We had a great time in London, but it was definitely not because of our accommodations.

We were met by clean lady for key hangover. Location is really good, the living room is comfy and lovely, the bedroom is good as well, though it is smaller than expected. Traffic noises were not a problem if you sleep in bedroom. During our first night stay, there were some issues with heating system and hot water, but Chil let her DIY man come over the next day, and it is all fixed. Chil is always quick reply and helped us to fix the problem. Anyway thank you so much!

The location of the apartment is top notch and minutes from the tube station. We enjoyed the stay and would recommend to others seeking a short stay in London.  The apartment was slighly let down by some expired food left in the fridge and a lumpy mattress, it would be fine for a few days but after a week we did start to feel the lumps.  Overall a positive stay.
Thank you again Chil. I had such a great time and. The terrace was to die for!!

I had a fantastic stay. Chil was very fast to respond and was more than accomodating with my changes to schedule - she really made my trip a breeze. The apartment was warm, very clean and cosy, and is in one of the best parts of London. It's also less than 5 minutes from the tube so all of London is at your fingertips. Highly recommended!
Very nice flat in a great part of town! We had a great time staying at Chil's flat as we explored London!

The apartment was tidy and bright as posted however quite tired with everything very basic. We really enjoyed the outdoor terrace at the end of a busy touring day. The bedroom was in a quite space but don't expect a luxury sleep. The location truly was amazing. At this price we both felt is was good value and Chil was very helpful and accessible. All and all a comfortable stay.

Chil's flat was amazing and very central to all the places we had planned to visit in London. The tube station was very close and convenient. My girlfriend and I had an amazing time staying in London and staying in her flat gave us a true experience of how it is to live in London. If you plan to visit London, Chil's flat is the place to be.

Comfortable flat in a great location with easy access to all public transport. We did not spend much time there as we were too busy exploring London but did enjoy a drink on the terrace on our last night. Although on a busy street, noise was not an issue for us.
Description was accurate. The host left ample linens and soap, shampoo, etc for our convenience. Also made herself available for any questions we may have had.
Our stay was great ! Chil was really helpful and made our arrival easy. The location is just amazing ! Highly recommended
The place is great. Perfect location, true to description, with an amazing terrace with a great view to one of Notting Hill's best streets. I fully recommend this Chil's apartment.
Chil's place was just as described. We loved hanging on the roof top terrace and the location was easy to get to. Would definitely recommend it!

Chil was A Great hoste! The flat And his location are just perfect to spend Time And visit London! All shops & restaurants. Are next door in addition to Notting Hill tube station which is 1 min well from The flat! Will recommend it for sure!
The flat was just as described in the listing & the area was prime. The rooftop patio was an absolute treat.

Chil did a great job communicating with us prior to arrival in London (traveling from the US) and while we were there.  The flat is in a perfect location - a block from the Tube and walking distance to some fantastic dining and pubs!  Our favorite amenity was the balcony.  The flat has everything you need for a comfortable stay - however the bedroom is small and the bed could be 'refreshed'...  Good value for the money.
Very Nice place exactly in the right spot. The tube around the corner. Hyde park within only a few minutes walk. Communication with Chil was easy.

This was a great place to stay for my holiday in London! It is in a very convenient spot, near Kensington Palace, Hyde Park, and Portobello Road.  I loved exploring the area.  Chil was a great host! The check-in and check-out process was a breeze.  Thank you for a great visit.

We arrived at the flat a little later than planned but this wasn't a problem for the host and was taken care of. The heating was on so the flat was warm and cosy when we arrived. 

It's a great place and we enjoyed the outside space,  watching the world go by from the roof terrace,  as much as the light, bright inside space. Great artwork too!!

The bed was comfortable and everything such as towels, hairdryer and extra if needed were catered for.

We went to eat at a restaurant we could see from the terrace so not far to walk! Also visited the local pub, which was bustlingly busy with a great atmosphere. Tried a restaurant called Polpo, which was excellent.

Superb location for the Tube, we also walked down to take a walk through Hyde Park to the Albert Memorial. I lovely place to come back to after a busy day out!
Amazing place with a really nice room and very friendly hosts. Would definitely recommend!

We enjoyed every bit of our stay at Philippa's apartment. The location affords quick access to public transportation with a bus stop around the corner and the underground a short walk away. The apartment was cozy and warm for our stay in October. Philippa was easy to communicate with before and during our stay and left us with plenty of instructions and tips. We would stay here and highly recommend!

This is a perfect flat for exploring London. Cosy, clean, close to the tube station, with many places for a substantial breakfast or a quick pint. Philippa is a super friendly and hospitable host. Out stay was great (including no problems with hot water which is not a rare thing in London and the heating inspite of the Beast from the East). A highly recommended place!

This was a great 1 bedroom flat with all the amenities of home. A short 8-10 minute walk to two tube stations as well as around the corner from the flat was a Waitrose market which has everything you need at great prices. The flat is located in a quiet area of Chelsea and a great place to come home to after sightseeing all day. I would stay here again in this Chelsea flat.

Perfect stay! Excellent location with the bus stop within 30 sec, and the tube within a 10 min walk. Central but still very quite. Great and safe area. Very easy check in and very well equipped lovely apartment, clean. Thank you Philippa!
Location,  location, location!!!  Philippa is the greatest,  the communication is outstanding.

We had a lovely and comfortable stay in Philippa’s flat. The location is great, we found several excellent restaurants nearby (favorites were Murials and the Ivy), and it’s a short walk to the Kensington Station. The flat is cozy and bright, it got a little warm with the windows closed but once you open a couple there are lovely breezes that cool it right down. The shower is amazing with fantastic water pressure! Philippa is very responsive to questions and never took more than a day to respond even while she is on her own vacation.  We traveled on our 1st anniversary and she left us a welcome card and an anniversary card also which was so sweet. Highly recommend!
As advertised, it is a great place to stay. This was my third visit and I hope to return next year.

This was a perfect place to stay for 10 days while sightseeing in London. It was a little larger than I anticipated and was quite comfortable for two. The location is excellent — close to several bus lines and lots to do within walking distance. The construction was not very disruptive since it took place mostly when we were awake and out of the house. Overall an excellent experience. Just be sure to follow Philippa’s instructions rather than GPS in finding the address!

Great time in London!
 Thanks to the owner of a beautiful house
Amazing location - great apartment, plenty of room for 4 - with space for more.  Well appointed rooms.  Easy to get to.  A great stay.

We loved our stay at the home of Elisa and Dom!  They were warm, inviting and very helpful in making recommendations for our visit to London. The room was comfortable and clean – the breakfast was delicious each morning. We couldn't have asked for a better place!
Everything was great! Especially the Tubestation nearby. It wasn't that clean in the kitchen. But it is a great Spot to stay when in London

Great place. Less than a 5 minute walk to Warren Street Tube Station, and buses to Piccadilly Circus, Charing Cross/Trafalgar Square, King's Cross/St. Pancras.
Clean, safe neighborhood with restaurants and pubs steps away.
A Tesco, Sainsbury and Pret a Manger are really close. 3 bds and 2 bthrm were enough to comfortably house 6 adults. Full kitchen, dish washer, and washing machine were a plus. No complaints. Would stay here again. Thanks Liz.

O apartamento é muito bom e a localização ótima, perto de várias estações de metro, supermercado, restaurantes e da até para ir caminhando para a Oxford Street. Apenas tivemos dificuldade com a utilização das máquinas de lavar louça e roupa. E Liz foi pronto ao atender nosso chamado para um reparo de urgência.

The flat is very nice and great location, near several tube stations, supermarkets, restaurants, also walking up to go to Oxford Street. We only had difficulty with the use of dishwashers and the washing machine, but Liz was ready to meet our call for an urgent repair.

The apartment was very clean, easy to use and was a great temporary home for us.  We stayed here for 9 days as we did some day trips out to various other cities across the UK.  The location is absolutely fabulous.  It is within walking distance of at least 5 different tube lines and two national rail stations, so day trips are super easy.  There are a host of restaurants, pubs, grocery stores, etc. in easy walking distance.  I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone!

Liz was really great to accomodate our need for an apt. only ONE day before we were leaving for London.

The apt. is very cute.  Liz left really detailed information about the apt. and was available in case we needed anything.

We love the neighborhood (walking distance to Soho/West End) and it was perfect for our needs.
Everything was perfect. I woud recommend this flat.
The location is perfect and the flat is very nice for 3 couples. Nice place to spend a good week-end or holidays in London. Enjoy
Perfect location - perfect flat! Couldn't get any better! Really enjoyed our stay and hope to be back soon!
